question: Which Indian bowler has become the highest International Wicket-Taker in 2018?
explanation: Indian pacer Jasprit Bumrah has become the highest international wicket-taker all formats in the calendar year 2018. He took 48 wickets in 9 Tests, 22 wickets in 13 ODIs and 8 wickets in 8 T20I matches. Hence, a total of 78 wickets in 2018 was taken by Bumrah. He surpassed South Africa\'s Kagiso Rabada\'s tally of 77 wickets to reach the milestone. While on the third position is Bumrah\'s countryman Kuldeep Yadav who took 76 scalps.
